channel.title: IRC applet on main page
channel.description:
moparisthebest supposedly supports free software, so I'm wondering why he chose the main page IRC applet to be the closed-source CBIRC.
[url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/irc.php]http://www.moparisthebest.com/irc.php[/url]
there are other java applet IRC clients, ones which are free software. I'm intrested to know the reasoning behind using CBIRC over another applet, for someone who appears to have supported free software so much.

item.title: IRC applet on main page
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:33, topic:269235”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=355315.msg2727676#msg2727676 date=1238471151]
Alright, it is up and running, with a link on the forum and a few options you can pass in to it. Comments?
[/quote]

http://www.moparisthebest.com/CBIRC.JAR still runs the old client; shouldn’t you remove that ?[/quote]

Yes, but you can’t run the jar without a matching HTML page.

Read full topic

item.title: IRC applet on main page
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:27, topic:269235”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=355315.msg2722757#msg2722757 date=1238104339]

Had that coming, frank_.

Well who else’s IRC would it be? #mopar is practically the only active channel.

You forget this is a dictatorship, nothing is owned by the people.
[/quote]
thats communism[/quote]
go away and don’t come back until you know what you’re talking about

Read full topic

item.title: IRC applet on main page
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Alright, it is up and running, with a link on the forum and a few options you can pass in to it. Comments?

http://www.moparisthebest.com/CBIRC.JAR still runs the old client; shouldn’t you remove that ?

item.title: IRC applet on main page
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:10, topic:269235”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=355315.msg2720206#msg2720206 date=1237927970]
As mopar would say, “if you make one, I’ll add it”, etc.
[/quote]

moparisthebest wouldnt say that as he would read my post properly and understand my point.

i wont make one but i will suggest one, of course there are many more which google can find, but this is my personal favourite.
http://www.pjirc.com/main.php

GPL’d, also it has its own GUI widgets, so it can work on peoples computers who do not have swing and an early version of the jre.[/quote]

I really like that, and if no one can come up with an alternative open source IRC applet I will use this. I agree that we should have an open source IRC client as well, since pretty much all the rest of the software we use is open source.

As to native IRC clients, I love X-chat on linux and X-chat2 on windows.

edit:

Alright, it is up and running, with a link on the forum and a few options you can pass in to it. Comments?

Read full topic

item.title: IRC applet on main page

Well who else’s IRC would it be? #mopar is practically the only active channel.
[/quote]
You forget this is a dictatorship, nothing is owned by the people.[/quote]

Well at least you all aren’t Commies!

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:29, topic:269235”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=355315.msg2720986#msg2720986 date=1237990792]
Yes, besides wouldn’t that attract more Moparscapians/retards into our IRC?
[/quote]
Most Moparscapians cant even use a simple IRC Client, so there would be nothing to worry about.
#moparscape has only 5 ppl online and nobody actualy talks.[/quote]
I suppose the dictators could ban them, even if they did come.

Read full topic

item.title: IRC applet on main page
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:12, topic:269235”][quote author=chrisn2323 link=topic=355315.msg2720345#msg2720345 date=1237934387]
why does it matter?
[/quote]

You can ask that question to basically every single post on this forum. In fact, you can ask that question to every topic that has ever been spoken. But, it is your mind that creates the reason by which you would care or would make this topic matter. If you can’t find that reason, then just ignore the topic and move on.[/quote]
wut

Read full topic
